intro: Epilobium nervosum, commonly known as the hairy willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as wet meadows and riverbanks. The plant features erect, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins. Its showy, pink to purple flowers bloom in racemes, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Epilobium nervosum is characterized by its adaptability to wet environments and its role in ecological succession.
